intro: Leptostemma lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf False Solomon's Seal, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and smartweeds. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in late spring and are clustered in racemes, followed by small, three-lobed berries. This plant thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded areas with rich, loamy soil.
